profileAlternative.name: Kyle (getify) Simpson
profileAlternative.headline: Mentor, Founder, Teacher
profileAlternative.summary:
Kyle Simpson is an evangelist of the open web, passionate about all things JavaScript. He writes books, teaches JavaScript, speaks, and contributes to the world of OSS.

Photo attribution: https://www.flickr.com/photos/halans/38293529466/

Specialties: JavaScript

aboutAlternative.text:
Kyle Simpson is an evangelist of the open web, passionate about all things JavaScript. He writes books, teaches JavaScript, speaks, and contributes to the world of OSS.

Photo attribution: https://www.flickr.com/photos/halans/38293529466/

Specialties: JavaScript

positions.title: Founder, Product Owner
positions.description: DevGo continuously mentors developers to accelerate in the workplace through our relational guided learning platform.

positions.title: Open Web Evangelist
positions.description: Training in: JavaScript, HTML5, node.js, web performance optimization, middle-end app architecture. Conference speaking, book writing, meetups and hack-a-thons organizing.

positions.title: Head of Curriculum
positions.description: Managing curriculum for all the national MakerSquare campuses, as well as mentoring teaching staff.

positions.title: Co-founder
positions.description: HubAustin Coworking is south Austin's first coworking space. I helped launch it.

positions.title: Software Engineer - DevTools
positions.description: Working on making world-class dev-tools for Mozilla products, like Firefox

positions.title: JavaScript Architect
positions.description: JavaScript development for enterprise data-information management application

positions.title: UI Lead
positions.description: Web based media player (video, photo, 360s) embeddable widget for ecommerce product pages, in JavaScript + HTML5 + Flash

positions.title: Independent
positions.description: Various contract and short-term positions in web UI development

positions.title: User Experience Architect
positions.description: UI/UX design, prototyping, usability testing, Flash development

positions.title: Sr. Presentation Layer Developer
positions.description: Primary UI developer on multiple Fortune 500 projects, including Southwest Airlines (http://www.southwest.com/), HEB Grocery (http://www.hebuddy.com/), JiffyLube (http://www.jiffylube.com/), AT&T, Nokia, and Dell.

given.text: Simply put, Kyle is a Javascript guru. Not only was Kyle able to solve every problem we came across, he managed to do so in a manner that was elegant and forward-thinking. He has an eye for usability and empathy for the end user, which I feel most developers lack. If you are looking for a problem solver, Kyle is your best bet.
Kyle has always been helpful to help and discuss different aspects of developing and evangelizing, and I appreciate his always friendly approach to me and my queries.

Kyle has always had a passion for JavaScript and open-source and it's evident in the efforts he manages. His big project, LabJS, is widely used and has received support from many industry luminaries. He's passionate about constantly evolving as a developer and is incredibly entrenched in the open-source community. Kyle is a great person as well and I would not only consider him a fantastic developer, but a friend.
…
See more

There really isn't anything to add to Kyle's ability as a JavaScript programmer beyond his resume and the other recommendations. He is really one of the most knowledgable and skilled people in the community. I most admired Kyle for his ability to help us see the big picture in our processes. Kyle was with us when we switched to Agile methodology. His experience and guidance was absolutely essential in making our transition work. Kyle challenged us to think beyond just written dogma, and refused to let us be complacent on challenging issues that we faced. Even though we worked on different engineering teams, seeing how Kyle worked helped me become a better programmer.
…
See more

Kyle has a passion for and a knowledge of Javascript that's hard to match. It drives his development and informs his architecture at a level beyond expectation. And he does all of it using IE7/8 as his primary browser; roll that one around for a bit.

Kyle is unquestionably a JavaScript guru...some might say one of the minor gods of JS. He's respected in the community, an invited speaker and generally considered one of the brightest minds in JavaScript in Austin. Kyle and I worked on different portions of our infrastructure, but his experience with software engineering methodologies helped ease us through a number of transition periods where the team in general wasn't particularly sure how to tiptoe into new processes. He's a smart, assertive software developer who cares deeply about the quality of his product.
…
See more

Kyle has always been my go to guy for anything web programming related. I use him as an expert consultant from a strategic standpoint and also to help with complex scripting because I know Kyle will deliver quickly no matter how sophisticated the project is. Kyle is a great communicator and first understands our company goals before diving into any project, this demonstrates maturity and empathy, which ensures we are aligned to drive success in what we do.
…
See more

received.text: During my time with MakerSquare (Hack Reactor), Alex worked as the head of instruction for the LA campus, and then transitioned to overseeing instruction at the national level. I've rarely met someone with such a unique mix of drive to get things done and empathy for people around him. He was ultra-dependable, creative, and a pleasure to work with. He would be a valuable addition to any team, and I'm confident he'll quickly rise to leadership wherever he lands.

Matt is one of the rare few developers I've worked with in my career who has a really strong sense of balance between "here's how it should be" and "here's what it takes to get it done".

He consistently outperforms most everyone else on the team with his strong drive to get solutions delivered, and yet he's smart enough to do so in a way that keeps an eye on how to create quality software over the long run. He is flexible and works on whatever tasks the team needs, and manages multiple priorities very well.

He is a very strong asset to any development team, and was great to work with, not only as a developer but also as a friend. I would highly recommend him, and it would be a pleasure to work with him again.

items: You Don't Know JS: ES6 & Beyond
You Don't Know JS: Up & Going
You Don't Know JS: Async & Performance
You Don't Know JS: Types & Grammar
You Don't Know JS: this & Object Prototypes
You Don't Know JS: Scope & Closures
